title: RIOT ADC's needs gutting not MAGES
body:
Everyone noticed the botlane and jungle dominates the game and there is no longer solo carry potential. Both Top and Mid feels shit.
**Riot you acknowledged that ADC's are way too strong and promised to fix them by mid season**. Instead we get what? You gut mages even more?
You balance team is incompetent shame on them.


Even if you remove my post many of us costumers are very unsatisfied. You can say goodbye for any RP purchasing until you fix your shit.

Edit 1 :  The only reason I play this  game is because my friends wants me to play with them and I got like 1 % hope that riot will fix its game, it used to be really fun. I stopped tryharding a year ago. I play 20 % of what I used to play or even less.  So many of you attack my opinion just because I'm silver. (this season only). I was platinum in season 5 and 6. Get a better argument since you got nothing.

replies.body: I must have missed it when they admitted ADCs are too strong.  Could you link it for me?

Don't have concrete link on that 1. But here is the newest input from riot :https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/general-discussion/27mrj62T-give-us-an-update-of-whats-coming-this-mid-season-dont-leave-us-in-the-shadows

**Riot Axes:**
Sure. Gonna talk more problem statement stuff than exact details but those'll be coming in the next couple weeks.

One thing to note is that we're doing less of a giant midseason release this year. Changes will come over a couple of patches, and it'll be smaller scope - there's no Runes Reforged or Elemental Drakes in this one. The changes that are there are likely to be significant, though. Likely to see changes aimed directly at Marksmen on 8.10 or 8.11, possibly both depending when work is finished, and then possible (but definitely not guaranteed) Fighter work in a follow-up patch.

We're looking at Marksmen with a few values:

    The mere fact of getting to two items shouldn't guarantee they're the most valuable champion on a team, but getting ahead should matter a lot.
    They need to be able to buy early items that ensure they can be fun, have responsive inputs (shoot-step-shoot is pretty unpleasant with no AS), and contribute appropriately. I take that to mean they need to get Attack Speed, potentially movement speed (though less required), and at least some punchy, powerful hits.
    We're going to be looking for ways to play up the difference between a snowballing champion and one that's merely on the curve - that includes Fighters, Assassins, ADCs, and Mages (though we think Mages are actually more correct than the other three - if they're behind, they provide primarily utility, if they're ahead they can be great damage carries). We'll especially value any time we can hit multiple of these classes with shared items - e.g. items that help both Fighters and Marksmen, or Assassins and Marksmen.
    Some opportunistic stuff - e.g. reducing the burst damage of very late game Infinity Edge builds to other squishy champions.

This will probably mean significant reworks to Infinity Edge, Essence Reaver, Last Whisper/Lord Dominik's Regards, cost changes to things like Phantom Dancer, possibly a new item, likely buffs to some underperforming items, plus some ADC base stat changes.

>  Likely to see changes aimed directly at Marksmen on 8.10 or 8.11, possibly both depending when work is finished, and then possible (but definitely not guaranteed) Fighter work in a follow-up patch.

Why you now rant liek all these other guys if you even have here the proof that it is **not** that riot will also handle adcs, but just 1, 2 patches later? 

**Ofcourse** the boards are full of "Whatabout" claims while crying that one broke class gets tuned a bit earlier for them to see as the other classes.
Just cause some clasess are broken **doesn't** justify that your calss can also be broken. Just means riot ahs to do stuff on a bunch of classes in general there they ahve shipped problems over the years: Cdr and free mana for everyone (funny that with less mana even if you go 45% cdr you hurt yourself if you spam without thinking), adc, mage and support itemization while toplane items still got kinda left behind, all these powercreep or focusing on just competive fused to some heavy inbalance. 

But saying Riot has destroyed the game and everytime they try to fix some classes same time crying over how unjustified it is to nerf "my beloved class" doesn't help anything.

Mages are not broken. Mages got counterplay and gated by mana and cooldowns. Right clicking has no counterplay. If anything Riot should have given out quick fix to ADC's by significantly nerfing their damage overall. Instead they are hurting classes that needs no nerf. Anyone protecting this practice are either adc mains or supports. Game has been dogshit for 2 years because of botlane dominance. Just scrolling trough the boards each day you can see that people dont like the game at the moment.

You realize that Assassins exist as well, right?
Mages currently crowd them out and they're supposed to be primarily mid laners. Assassins also are a natural counter to Marksmen and they're nowhere to be found. Buffing Lethality isn't making things better because then the Assassins overtake the role/position and make everyone's life miserable, having to be nerfed yet again. And then certain champions who can use Lethality that aren't Assassins, rise to power unintentionally.

Assassins got their Duskblade nerfs/compensation buffs to make sure that Duskblade isn't such a powerful first purchase and that their power level doesn't depend on this item. Now Riot's looking into other potential changes, like Mages that can super waveclear everything and still roam a lot for successful ganks.

Third reason that you're not considering is that Riot's likely also trying to lay some groundwork for potential bot lane meta changes that would allow some mages to be primary carries there and replace some Marksmen. Allowing these bot mages to outdamage, outpoke and outtrade everyone due to how mana isn't such a big issue anymore, could be one of the concerns there. It may also increase the duration of the laning phase for mid laners, due to some items getting a bit more expensive.

That also leaves bot and top lane with a bit more time to stay and farm, actually increasing the game duration slightly. You're not even looking how this change can have an impact from a few different perspectives, all because they're not directly nerfing Marksmen because you think they need to be. And surprise surprise, they're also doing that as well.
Assassins are not struggling wtf are you talking about? If anything they suck at killing the adc just like mages. Even more reason to nerf adc's if their natural counter cant kill them.

> [{quoted}](name=OP Garen Support,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=E8gtk1Xs,comment-id=000000000000000000020000,timestamp=2018-04-19T12:29:18.262+0000)
>
> Assassins are not struggling wtf are you talking about? If anything they suck at killing the adc just like mages. Even more reason to nerf adc's if their natural counter cant kill them.

Then where are mid lane assassins, if they are good?
Apart from Zed and Talon, i'm not seeing anyone in my games.
They can't fight the mages they're up against and they can't kill Marksmen. So what's actually that big thing they bring to the table, in order to make them into a viable class?

Marksmen are getting nerfed, as i've said and as you've sourced it from Riot Axes himself.
Which assassin struggles on mid? Last I checked they beat mages on lane.  Buying {{item:3155}} shuts down mages completely.

> [{quoted}](name=OP Garen Support,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=E8gtk1Xs,comment-id=00000000000000000002000000000000,timestamp=2018-04-19T13:27:13.374+0000)
>
> Which assassin struggles on mid? Last I checked they beat mages on lane.  Buying {{item:3155}} shuts down mages completely.

OK, why are mages only viable mid laners? If it's that easy to counter their burst early and they're more mobile, i see no reason why mages are predominant class for mid lane.

When arguing a role is to dominant and then you give the explanation “right clicking has no counter play” makes you sound like you have no idea why they are strong lmao... really that again?

First of all your grouping Adc’s like they are all good, nah just the ones who are suppose to be late hyper carries but get 2 items and are already outputting ridiculous damage.

The boards and reddit complain about Ka sai being trash the first week riot buffs her without waiting for her to stabilize now we have this monster.
Now people come crying she’s to op when they asked for their own doom.

Please list 3 Adc’s without counterplay completely besides Ka sai right now
I don't feel like writing 1 page about what's wrong with the ADC's just read a random adc topic on the boards yourself. I doubt your blind favoritism is any better then riots.
Gated by mana.... Not before these CHanges. Gated By Cooldowns..... more than adcs yea but over the past 3 years not so much out side of early lane.

Melee movespeed items lose their movespeed bonus once in combat. How about buffing the value of pd by removing of halving the movespeed of other zeal items in combat - like once an adc has taken damage from a champion. This rewards enemies for getting on the adc, punishes adc's that don't kite properly, and makes pd vs other zeal items a meaningful decision.

Crit - just convert champs to play out like ashe with crit. Removes rng and helps trynd cs better without having surprise one-hit kills thanks to rng - as well as doing the same for adc's.

Revert a ton of the buffs to adc's that were given to help deal with "adc in 2k17" problems - namely tank base damage. Then... rather than gut tanks like what's currently being done, rework more of their basic farming abilities so that their damage to minions stays the same, but their damage to CHAMPS with the same abilities is lower... think rumble q but in reverse. This would bring adc's more into line with other champs, help non-tank toplaners w/o having to gut tanks, and also help opponents who are jumped on by a tank not have to worry so much about being blown up while still rewarding the tank by allowing them to be tanky.

Kaboom. Multiple issues solved all at once. And in a very reasonable manner. Rewards champs' strengths and punishes their weaknesses properly. Enables more classes to do their jobs well if done properly while punishing them for poor play.

The constant movespeed ADC's have is what bugs me the most. I'm tired of getting onto an ADC because they position poorly and having them able to just attack move away because of 2 zeal items.

Kiting means you keep people at range, not that you can gain range when people get onto you.

Yeah basically that's why all these melee champs are either being played full tank or built to 1-shot and are stupidly squishy and troll builds for teamfights most of the season. Either they go full tank and are only useful for the cc they bring, or they hope to 1-shot adc and win fight off that. If they can't, any damage they do is irrelevant because... lifesteal and healing via support items and  the fact that with even just a single peeling ability from one teammate, the adc cannot be caught again unless you have infinite gapclosers like akali. Unlike past seasons, you largely cannot afford to focus anyone but the adc unless both sides focus the frontline. Well when that happens, bruisers and fighters get screwed because their dps to to tanks isn't enough to outweigh the extra damage they take from the enemy team compared to what the enemy tank takes in damage from your team. Thus... league of tanks top - barring ranged or splitpush full damage champs with extreme safety in lane like vlad, gp, camille are the norm for most of season.

It doesn't take a genius to figure it out, but I don't think Riot has. It's like how they took half a season to figure out how to nerf tank ekko when he was broken. Hmmm... a full tank (except triforce) champ is doing too much damage and can stick to enemies better than anyone else (at the time). How do we deal with this... Nerf is base damage? No, that would never work. We're going to try this first. That just made him stronger? .... half a season later... we nerfed ekko's base damage and buffed his ap scaling to incentivize him to go ap. Community just shakes their heads.
Last time I checked, the PBE isn't the set in stone end all be all mid-season. Riot Axes even said, as you linked in a previous comment, Marksmen are being addressed aswell.

> [{quoted}](name=Xäyąh,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=E8gtk1Xs,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-04-18T15:16:00.919+0000)
>
> Last time I checked, the PBE isn't the set in stone end all be all mid-season. Riot Axes even said, as you linked in a previous comment, Marksmen are being addressed aswell.

I'll believe it when I see it. Riot hasn't done much to inspire faith. I'm still waiting on that Yasuo rework they told us was coming sometime last season.
Citation needed for yasuo rework. Are you talking about the april fools video they did where they have yasuo 8 tornados and a 0 cd ultimate?

> [{quoted}](name=Xäyąh,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=E8gtk1Xs,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2018-04-18T15:51:51.764+0000)
>

https://nexus.leagueoflegends.com/en-us/2017/06/ask-riot-yasuo-gets-banned/

Think it's 5th paragraph down where they say looking into an ability focused update like Rek'Sai. Anyway  10 months later, he is still cancer to play against, about to be even more so with the mana nerfs coming.
Ask riot is all pr bullshit. You cannot trust anything in an ask riot
Then why the fuck you are even here
What? On the boards? Just because I don't like ask riot doesn't mean I can't use the boards or play the game

> [{quoted}](name=OnanThaMan,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=E8gtk1Xs,comment-id=0002000000000000,timestamp=2018-04-18T15:55:11.484+0000)
>
>they say _**are looking into**_ an ability focused update for Yasuo

This wasn't a confirmation that Yasuo rework is (was) in the works.
"Looking into" means explorative work to figure out whether one is possible, in a few directions. You have to read their posts very carefully because i'm getting a feeling that, when Riot comes somewhere to explain some things, many people just skim it to get the gist of it. And then a couple of months later, we get this farce of "mislead" players who think Riot wronged them because they couldn't read a comment word by word, in order to not get the wrong idea about something that's been said in the past.

People ask of Riot to be transparent. But there's only so much transparency there can be. RIot won't talk about things that even they're not sure will ever get to see the light of day. But if they do, Rioters know exactly how to word their posts in order not prevent misunderstandings. People just need to read more carefully.
They already said it never got started and probably wont happen.
Thanks for the citation. But in that same post they said that they didn’t even start looking into yasuo yet, so it is still a potential thing to happen in the future.

> [{quoted}](name=OnanThaMan,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=E8gtk1Xs,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2018-04-18T15:49:34.022+0000)
>
> I'll believe it when I see it. Riot hasn't done much to inspire faith. I'm still waiting on that Yasuo rework they told us was coming sometime last season.

Fuck yasou honestly.  He doesn't get to jump the Rework que just because Riot #finally  admitted he's a problematic champion after  having it Yelled in thier face since  his Release.

yea well, they don't believe the community, and reddit filters any messages that are directly at riot. 

How can you have actual complaints when there are none that riot can actually see?

They don't use their fucking boards.
You are talking to the same tards that instead of lowering Ornns damage,they removed his W unstoppable,so yeah...
I haven't heard any complain about mages for a long time. It is strange they attack them.
ADC's gonna get nerfed but sneaky Riot nerfs other roles first, so that everything will stay the same when mid season comes.

> [{quoted}](name=OP Garen Support,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=E8gtk1Xs,comment-id=,timestamp=2018-04-18T12:12:25.657+0000)

As if that mana alone does anything useful.

Besides just sitting there.

So why are we touching that first?

Because they want the high damage, so the way they are handling the complaints is by going with the limiting resources. I have a suspicion they will be hitting adc's sustain mid season, and shuffling some ad / as items around. 

Not sure how they are going to handle the bruiser itemization.

> [{quoted}](name=GigglesO,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=E8gtk1Xs,comment-id=000300000000,timestamp=2018-04-18T16:44:36.500+0000)

> 
> Not sure how they are going to handle the bruiser itemization.

So basically we gutted {{item:3003}} and said mages have too much mana and it's a problem on {{item:3003}} so we must nerf base mana and item mana on all items so {{item:3003}} isn't abused. Meanwhile, you are telling me they are adding more damage while they only nerfed mana. Also they nerfed damage when they nerfed {{item:3003}} since that was the only source of mages damage for a while. While ADC's run rampant with assassin burst. Since like S6 or S7 I may add.

Sounds logical.

Mana = Waveclear

but it's ok, let's make sure Lost Chapter is never nerfed so the issue persists.

> [{quoted}](name=AirKingNeo,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=E8gtk1Xs,comment-id=000300000001,timestamp=2018-04-18T21:42:18.865+0000)
>
> Mana = Waveclear
> 
> but it's ok, let's make sure Lost Chapter is never nerfed so the issue persists.

Mana does damage by itself? Since when?
{{champion:99}} Yeah totally has too much mana.  Enough for a whole 5 Es at level 9, and that's talking current mana levels.

Unless you have a {{item:3802}} {{item:3070}}  Which is literally the first two items for every mage. 

And with the buffs to {{item:3027}}  they expect you to build that.

It also takes Lux 2 Es to clear a wave or an E, 7+ autos, and a Q.

Also that build takes so long to scale that by the time it's finished stacking on Lux, you'll be past the point in the game where you can sometimes succeed at bursting someone.  Don't forget they also nerfed the AP on {{item:3003}} before it turns into {{item:3040}}.

Maybe they are toning down damage, and they just started with the mages?

They might go mages adc's, then touch up the bruisers followed by tanks.

Except that makes them do more damage in the late game, less damage in the mid game, and narrows build diversity even further.  And that still makes her laning phase even worse.

All this does is encourage more tear-focused laners like Anivia.  Champions who just waveclear until their items scale up.

> [{quoted}](name=GigglesO,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=E8gtk1Xs,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2018-04-18T15:37:45.945+0000)
>
> Mages still have too much mana

Yet they are still limited by it, while ADC's can do better than anything a mage can do while not being gated at all by any ressource

This isn't gutting, the fuck? Ah, boards are talking about subjects they don't understand again. Mages went from being a role with mana as a resource to a brainless spam fest on mid ever since they kept adding more mana to items on top of having runes like Manaflow band. Over the years mages have been made so much easier for any brainless monkey that can press 2 buttons in lane to clear the wave.

> Mid feels shit.

That's a very subjective observation buddy. You don't even play mid. If anything these changes will refresh the lane.

Brainless spam fest? Free auto attacks doing more damage then mage full rotation?

My 3 highest played champs are : {{champion:90}} {{champion:25}} {{champion:45}} and you say Im not a mage main lol?

You know where mages go? Yes to midlane. 

Ah yes you are Kata main you sure know much about resource management.

We're talking about mages here, not ADCs. ADCs are a different subject, you're just comparing dogs and cows in order to whine more.

> My 3 highest played champs are : {{champion:90}} {{champion:25}} {{champion:45}}    and you say Im not a mage main lol?

Were* You didn't even play mid during s8.

> Ah yes you are Kata main you sure know much about resource management.

I obviously play mages as well. But that's right, Silvers of the boards know how the game ACTUALLY works. Exactly as i said, people who have no fucking clue how to play the lane are posting shit.
I have been playing mid on my EU west account. I was platinum Malzahar main for 2 years. You just argue for the sake of arguing. Go away noone like Kata mains.

Really? I'M the one arguing for the sake of arguing? You people are posting things that you don't fully understand yourselves. There's a reason why players in higher elo try to stay calm, think these changes through and adapt to them instead of instantly whining about the changes like lower elo does.

> I have been playing mid on my EU west account. I was platinum Malzahar main for 2 years.

Source: Dude, trust me

I'll definitely believe that from someone who's unable to get out of Silver on EUNE. Also, even if you do that doesn't really change anything.

If you care so much about me being silver now. The only reason I play this trash game is because my friends wants me to play with them. I stopped tryharding  a year ago. I play 20 % of what I used to play or even less. I was platinum in season 5 and season 6 when the game was still fun. 

Why do you even argue if you are too lazy to check facts.

Cause that's like saying hashinshin was Challenger in season 5 so he still must be Challenger material.

> I was platinum in season 5 and season 6 when the game was still fun.

When the game was different. People need to learn how to adapt instead of complain.
That's a terrible way to go about living, complaing is how things change. If no one ever complained nothing would ever get done
